author: jaimeyu

changelog.release_notes:
Fix bootup bug.
Fix GPS tracking.

This version has a bug fix that solved the lagginess when requesting for stop data. This was because the js timeout was triggered almost immediately which blocked the correct http request from getting to the pebble watch.
I added a better number selector because it can take 5 minutes to go from 0 to 3000. Turns out I had people going all the way to 7000... I can only imagine how much that sucked. The new version fixes that with a better number selector. I moved the number selector into its own module so it should be relatively easy to use in other projects.
Added some default bus / stop numbers to make scrolling easier. Future version will have a better stop selector.

Redesigned for > 2.6 Pebble releases. Since 2.6, the app has been crashing at boot up. New visual layout. New button mapping. See description. Near complete rewrite. Improved REST API so requests should be < 300 ms for much improved responsiveness. Old releases relied on downloading the entire JSON package. This release uses a new logic path that does most of the work on the server side. Removed the clock bar for visual real estate reasons. May come back in future releases (please let me know if you need it). Ground work laid to store favorites stops.

description:
This app will keep you to up to date on your next upcoming OC Transpo bus. It periodically updates itself so it will always have the latest information for you. 

Button layout:
UP -> Select bus route
DOWN -> Select stop number
SELECT -> Long press -> Switch direction
SELECT -> Short press -> Manual refresh

In the number selector:
SELECT -> Move to the next digit
UP -> Increment number
DOWN -> Decrement number

latest_release.release_notes:
Fix bootup bug.
Fix GPS tracking.

title: Travvik
